posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Reason to take BG levels was in making 4 APR schedule for this char. Also, stacking Bull's, little improvement in saving throws, some sneak attacks... We still need to pass nice amount of opponent's AC, remember? )
You have 37 AB. That means (not factoring any buffs), that your "base schedule" would be: +37/+32/+27/+22. That last attack will invariably have 5% chance to hit (only if you roll a 20), even more so because you say the AC of your foes is high, so it's not such an indispensible thing to have IMO. The BAB you lose by going RDD is recovered by the Strength gain that the class gives you. Your BAB in my suggested alternative would be 14 at lvl 20, but your Strength would end up at 38, effectively giving you +2 AB in comparison to yours, even with one attack less. That also means that if you have access to Divine Power scrolls in abundance, you will have +1 attack at FULL BAB instead of -15 for the duration of the spell. This was recently explained by Kail in the topic Battle Priestess, I think.

As a general rule, though, you can't be a critical immune, heavy-hitting, high AB, damage dealing, self buffing juggernaut. You need to choose between mutually exclusive things: The more PM levels you take, the earlier you become immune to criticals and the higher your AC is with bone skin (not to mention epic spells), but in order to achieve that, your buffs, spells and bard song will suffer because of your heavy investment in PM. We had a discussion about this kind of thing in the WoG forums, and people were saying exactly that. Novice builders have a tendency to want to achieve too much with a build, and end up being mediocre in all areas rather than good at something. Your stats are low, your self-buffing capability is somewhat limited in this build except through scrolls, so your AB will be low regardless.

Another important point here is the level distribution. You end up in 18 PM levels. That is the same as 16, so those two levels can be put into BG for +1 BAB, or bard for better spell durations and such. Roughly, though, I think this build needs somewhat radical changes. You need to decide what is more important to you and stick with it. Honestly, for what you are saying there, I would suggest going either with the Bard PM RDD combo (14 16 10 or 11 19 10) or Cleric Bard PM. Why? Because Clerics can afford to have low BAB, as they're specialists in self-buffing. You can either go Cleric 15 Bard 6 PM 19 and be dispellable but have access to Epic Warding and Epic Mage Armor or Cleric 26 Bard 4 PM 10 and have lower AC but be undispellable. You would end up with low BAB, but the Cleric's capacity to self-buff is AMAZING. You could go Cleric 12 Bard 3 PM 5 or Cleric 15 Bard 3 PM 2 pre-epic and get critical immune earlier by going straight PM on epics.

I will see what I can come up with later this week, cuz now I have no time. Think about what I said, plz.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Nice going, Hip. Never is one wrong to quote a Mithdradates build!

D'alessandro,

I would tweak a bit on that build you posted for the original intent, in order to get PM as high as possible as fast as possible. +2 fully buffed AB and +3 AC points difference from Cleric 12 to Cleric 15 won't make much of a difference, but the earlier epic spells would, so I would personally go PM straight and leave the cleric levels from 37-40 alongside the bard level. I would also take Epic Warding before Epic Mage Armor, as having 50/+20 DR and immunity to criticals is a hell of a combo. They will only do extra damage to you via darkfire, which goes to address the PM bonus feat. Put Epic Energy Resistance Fire to deal with Darfire / Flame Weapon or Acid to deal with Mestil's Acid Sheath. With your very high AC i`d go for Acid.

11 points on Heal there seem wasted. you could put 5 more in UMD as it's never too much to have. The rest, if you have nowhere better to place, Heal is fine. I would consider dropping Taunt for Discipline, unless you got KD-immune items in the server. With the addition of Cleric, your AB is no longer considered low.

Take it EZ!

Just so you know, you may not remember but the Divine Power / Haste exploit has been slightly reworked in a way it's still better to have 3 attacks per round rather than 4 with a cleric.

before: say your AB is 40 with DP and Haste. Your schedule would be

+40/+35/+30/+40 (DP)/+40(Haste).

Now: same deal, 40 AB, your schedule will be:

+40/+35/+30/+40 (Haste)/+35 (DP)

Now each extra attack is added at -5 from the previous in case of multiple extra attacks. If you turned on Rapid Shot, for example, the above would become:

+38/+33/+28/+38/+33/+28

pretty different from what you were used to back in the day. This feels a little like Magic:The Gathering, where they make a point to create a special ability that fucks over all previously existing special abilities (A.K.A "X" cannot be killed), and then in the next patch they release a card with a special ability to screw with that new overpowered ability, like "Removes target card from the game". So now it's not killed, but it can be removed from the game, so your precious mighty ultra unkillable card is now worthless. They do that stuff to keep you buying

D'alessandro

The reason for taking cleric to 12 pre-epic is that ALL CLERIC SIGNIFICANT BUFFS gain an increase there:

Divine Favor - +1 every 3 levels of cleric - +4 at 12, caps at 15
GMW - +1 every 3 levels of cleric - +4 at 12, caps at 15
Shield of Faith - +2 and +1 every 6 levels of cleric - +4 at 12, caps at 18
Magic Vestment - +1 every 3 lvls of cleric - +4 at lvl 12, caps at 15
Darkfire - 1d6 +1 every 2 levels of cleric - Caps at +5 (lvl 10)

That is why, besides the obvious BAB issue, you don't take more PM earlier. At Cleric 12 your buffs are sufficiently strong for you to manage to start your investment in PM

Hip´

The first alternative would grant you a few spell slots and a little more durations, while the latter would grant you +2 boneskin AC. Less than 5 Bard IMO is undoable, as he will have to spend too much of his life without skill updates because he'd have to take the 3rd level of bard at 15 to start pumping PM and then the next one after 37 if he went Bard 4. By going Bard 5 he can get one extra skill dump in the middle, which is absolutely necessary to face the monsters he was talking about in mid 20s. Dalessandro. That build you posted is horrible in terms of playability. You just randomly picked levels to put bard in with ABSOLUTELY no logic. Read my guide, mate! Let me enlighten you:

Start as Bard, you gain more skill points this way. You won't be able to take Extend Spell, so take Power Attack instead. Now you don't need to worry about AB anytime because you're a Cleric, so leave the Weapon Focus for later, prioritize Cleave, KD, Extend Spell. Take Bard on levels 1, 12 and 15 anc all Cleric inbetween. Then PM at 16, 17, Bard 18 and PM 19 and 20. That way you can maintain UMD and Tumble at full for the first 20 levels.

Forget about Bard at 28 and 33, because Bard 6 gives you nothing, so take Bard 5 at 38 and be done with it. You will be without UMD and Tumble updates for a while, but it will grant you +2 AC from Bone Skin, which will make you even harder to hit. As for domains, Travel and Trickery are good, but you could also consider Strength for another level of Divine Power. Problem is, which one to drop? If there are no permanent haste items in your server, then leave domains as they are, but if you can find them, drop Travel for Strength.

Other than that, I would consider it a good build. I want to start working on something like this myself, but right now I don't have time.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Cleric 20/Bard 4/PM 16 sounds so much better if you ask me. The extra spellslots and caster levels are simply priceless.

Also PM 5 at lvl 20 means you are throwing away 1 AB unnecessarily. Go Bard 4 there.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane

Also PM 5 at lvl 20 means you are throwing away 1 AB unnecessarily. Go Bard 4 there.
I would say so as well, but he mentions fighting the toughest server mobs at mid-20s so he may require a delayed skill dump for it. If you ask me, I would still go with 12 4 4 pre-epic anyway.

as for 20 4 16 i would say they aren't all that useful, mainly because he doesn't plan to cast much, as he has already hinted and also because you'd have to squeeze in another 1 or 2 to Wisdom, which in a build up to 16 cleric levels he doesn't have to worry about. IMO for what he intends with it, it's good as is.

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content:
Maximillian Kane wrote:
KailPendragon wrote:Cleric 20/Bard 4/PM 16 sounds so much better if you ask me. The extra spellslots and caster levels are simply priceless.

Also PM 5 at lvl 20 means you are throwing away 1 AB unnecessarily. Go Bard 4 there.
I would say so as well, but he mentions fighting the toughest server mobs at mid-20s so he may require a delayed skill dump for it. If you ask me, I would still go with 12 4 4 pre-epic anyway.
The difference is -1 AC for 5 less tumble till the final skill dump in exchange for a permanent +1 AB. 12/4/4 is a no brainer if one is to keep that split.
as for 20 4 16 i would say they aren't all that useful, mainly because he doesn't plan to cast much, as he has already hinted and also because you'd have to squeeze in another 1 or 2 to Wisdom, which in a build up to 16 cleric levels he doesn't have to worry about. IMO for what he intends with it, it's good as is.
He already has 18 Wis and the extra spell slots (+1 lvl 4/5/6 spells, +2 lvl 7/8 spells, +4 lvl 9 spells) and caster level from going cleric 20 vs cleric 15 constitute a huge advantage. A cleric has no spell failure so giving up spells that are easily gonna change the outcome of a battle cause one doesn't want to cast much means not using the class properly. One doesn't need cleric at all to build a crit immune dev critter, if one is to use cleric let's get the most out of it. Just some thoughts.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content: To get the most out of Cleric, Mith's build is the best way to go. However, that has been suggested over and over again and the OP doesn't seem to relish the idea. That's why I came up with this alternative spread that focuses more on the PM side. I wouldn't recommend going 20 4 16 and not taking 20 wisdom. If he does decide to go with that, I 'd consider a higher WIS score as a must have.
